title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey shows only 33.7% feel less safe in downtown Boston in 2025, down from 70.6% in 2024.
Public safety summit in Boston tackles issues like drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure cleanliness.
Retail vacancies in downtown Boston at lowest since COVID-19, attributed to increased sense of safety.

title: Patriots 21, Falcons 7 (2nd): Diggs’ TD gives Pats breathing room
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots lead the Atlanta Falcons 21-7 in the second quarter at Gillette Stadium.
Drake Maye throws two touchdowns, including an 11-yard pass to Stefon Diggs.
Rhamondre Stevenson is out with a toe injury; TreVeyon Henderson may see increased reps.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants have been indicted in a statewide sex trafficking case involving multiple counties in Massachusetts.
Gianni Martinez, 23, and his grandmother Rosa Garcia, 68, allegedly orchestrated trafficking operations in Essex, Middlesex, Plymouth, and Suffolk.
Five alleged buyers and other accomplices, including Wally Nunez and Abner Vaquerano, face various charges related to sexual servitude.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted 'SNL' on Nov. 2 for the second time, with Brandi Carlile as the musical guest.
The episode featured a mock NYC mayoral debate with Teller portraying Andrew Cuomo alongside recent 'SNL' hosts.
Brandi Carlile, on her fourth 'SNL' appearance, previously performed with Elton John in a standout episode.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts regulators partially denied Eversource's proposed rate hike, potentially saving customers millions in heating costs this winter.
Eversource failed to meet three out of 18 performance metrics related to safety, customer satisfaction, and emissions set in 2020.
Gov. Maura Healey opposed the rate increase; Eversource plans to review the decision and may pursue a full rate hike.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School is investigating a racist incident involving a plastic figure wearing a Black student's jersey hung by a belt.
The school identified those responsible and is working to ensure accountability and healing, according to Principal Allyson Mizoguchi.
Wayland Police and the DA's office are conducting an investigation and plan a community discussion about the incident.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Kevin Durant scored 26 points leading the Houston Rockets to a 128-101 victory over the tired Boston Celtics.
Boston Celtics lost their winning streak after playing their third game in four days, impacting overall performance.
Celtics experienced significant free-throw disparity with a 35-7 deficit against the Rockets, affecting game outcome.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate veteran RB D'Ernest Johnson to the 53-man roster for Sunday's game against the Atlanta Falcons.
Injuries to Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson have left New England's running back depth depleted this season.
Johnson, with seven NFL seasons, may contribute on offense and special teams, offering experience to the Patriots.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Charlie McAvoy pairs with Nikita Zadorov to improve team defense over last three games.
Bruins reduced high-danger scoring chances with Zadorov-McAvoy pairing, winning three consecutive games.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot's presence strengthen Bruins' defensive lineup.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman excelled in goal for the Bruins, stopping 27 of 28 shots in a 2-1 win over Carolina.
Coach Marco Sturm adjusted the goalie rotation, starting Joonas Korpisalo in back-to-back games after Swayman's tough loss to Ottawa.
Swayman continues to lead with a higher save percentage (.896) and goals saved above expected (2.0) than Korpisalo.
